content: Once you revoke the consent to use the {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth data in the service {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} will automatically stop logging into {{name}}. Your account in {{name}} will not be deleted.

comment.text: This translation key is used to describe what happens when a user revokes consent to use their {{organizationName}} {{productName}} authentication data. It will be displayed in a dialog (RevokeDialog) when a user chooses to revoke consent and informs them that their account will not be deleted, but the service will stop logging into their account.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation uses "بيانات تفويض" (bayanat tafweedh) for "auth data". While technically correct, a more natural and common phrasing in this context would be something like "بيانات تسجيل الدخول" (bayanat tasjeel al-dookhol) or "بيانات المصادقة" (bayanat al-musaadaqa).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "بيانات تسجيل الدخول" or "بيانات المصادقة" instead of "بيانات تفويض".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'revoke the consent to use' is not accurately translated. 'İstifadə etmək icazəsini ləğv etdikdə' is a bit literal and could be improved for naturalness. A more natural translation might be '{{organizationName}} {{productName}} hesabının {{name}} xidmətində identifikasiya məlumatı istifadə etmək hüququnu ləğv etdiyinizdə'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{organizationName}} {{productName}} hesabının {{name}} xidmətində identifikasiya məlumatı istifadə etmək hüququnu ləğv etdiyinizdə

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of 'will automatically stop logging into' is a bit awkward. 'Avtomatik olaraq {{name}} hesabına daxil olmağı dayandıracaq' is literal. A more natural phrasing would be '{{name}} hesabına girişini dayandıracaq'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{name}} hesabına girişini dayandıracaq

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Your account in {{name}} will not be deleted' is too literal. It's better to rephrase it to '{{name}} hesabınız silinməyəcək'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{name}} hesabınız silinməyəcək

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "logging into" is not accurate. "Влиза" (vliza) implies entering a system, which is not the correct meaning in the context of authentication data.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a more precise term like "автоматично няма да може да се удостоверява" (avtomatichen ne ma da se udostveryava) which translates to 'will automatically be unable to authenticate'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "Your account" should more accurately reflect "profile" as indicated in the English content. "Профил" is the correct term here.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed, "Вашият профил" is accurate and reflects the English context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Missing period after organizationName in the Czech translation. The sentence is abruptly cut off.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po odvolání souhlasu s použitím {{organizationName}} {{productName}} autorizačních údajů ve službě {{name}}, {{organizationName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'autorizačních údajů' is a literal translation of 'auth data'. It's technically correct, but a more natural Czech phrasing might be 'přístupových údajů' or 'ověřovacích údajů'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po odvolání souhlasu s použitím {{organizationName}} {{productName}} přístupových/ověřovacích údajů ve službě {{name}}, {{organizationName}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'Auth-Daten' is a direct translation of 'auth data' but sounds unnatural in German. It's better to use a more common phrasing like 'Authentifizierungsdaten' or 'Zugangsdaten'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sobald Sie die Zustimmung zur Nutzung der Authentifizierungsdaten von {{organizationName}} {{productName}} im Dienst {{name}} widerrufen...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'die Anmeldung bei {{name}} stoppen' is a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would be 'den Login zu {{name}} beenden' or 'nicht mehr bei {{name}} anmelden können'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Sobald Sie die Zustimmung zur Nutzung der Authentifizierungsdaten von {{organizationName}} {{productName}} im Dienst {{name}} widerrufen, wird {{organizationName}} {{productName}} den Login zu {{name}} beenden.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "auth data" is translated as "δεδομένων εξουσιοδότησης". While technically correct, it's a bit clunky and less natural in Greek. A more common and understandable translation would be "δεδομένων πρόσβασης" or "δεδομένων χρήσης".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Μόλις ανακαλέσετε τη συγκατάθεση για τη χρήση των δεδομένων πρόσβασης του {{productName}} της {{organizationName}} στην υπηρεσία {{name}}, το {{productName}} της {{organizationName}} θα σταματήσει αυτόματα να συνδέεται στο {{name}}. Ο λογαριασμός σας στο {{name}} δεν θα διαγραφεί.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "kirjautumisen tilille" is not the most natural way to express "logging into". A more natural translation would be "kirjautumisen" or "sisäänkirjautumisen".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jos peruutat suostumuksen käyttää {{organizationName}} {{productName}} todennustietoja palvelussa {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} lopettaa automaattisesti sisäänkirjautumisen {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "verkkotunnuksessa" (in the domain) is not the correct word choice. "Palvelussa" is more suitable as the content refers to the service itself, not the domain where the service resides.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jos peruutat suostumuksen käyttää {{organizationName}} {{productName}} todennustietoja palvelussa {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} lopettaa automaattisesti sisäänkirjautumisen {{name}}. Tiliäsi palvelussa {{name}} ei poisteta.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Երբ չեղարկեք... համաձայնությունը" is an awkward phrasing. A more natural way to say 'Once you revoke the consent' would be 'Երբ չեղարկեք համաձայնությունը'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Երբ չեղարկեք համաձայնությունը

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ավտոմատ կերպով կդադարեցնի մուտքը' could be improved for clarity.  It literally translates to 'will automatically stop the entry'.  A better phrasing would indicate stopping the automatic login.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ավտոմատ կերպով դադարեցնելու է մուտքը

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "stop logging into" is not the most natural Italian translation for "stop accessing". A better phrasing would convey the action of revoking access rather than simply stopping the login action.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Una volta revocato il consenso all'uso dei dati di autenticazione di {{organizationName}} {{productName}} nel servizio {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} non potrà più accedere a {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Il vostro account' sounds slightly formal. While not incorrect, a more conversational and friendly tone might be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Il tuo account

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation lacks consistent use of punctuation, specifically periods at the end of sentences. While not strictly incorrect, it affects readability and flow in Japanese. It's common to end sentences with periods.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{organizationName}}の{{productName}}認証データを{{name}}で使用することへの同意を取り消すと、{{organizationName}}の{{productName}}は自動的に{{name}}へのログインを停止します。{{name}}のアカウントは削除されません。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Once you revoke the consent" is not accurately translated. A more natural Korean phrasing would be '{{organizationName}} {{productName}} 인증 데이터 사용에 대한 동의를 취소하시면'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{organizationName}} {{productName}} 인증 데이터 사용에 대한 동의를 취소하시면

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'stop logging into' is not naturally translated. '{{name}}에 로그인하는 것을 중단합니다' can be improved to '{{name}}에 로그인하는 것을 멈춥니다' or '더 이상 {{name}}에 로그인되지 않습니다'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 더 이상 {{name}}에 로그인되지 않습니다

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation includes multiple instances of "{{name}}" and "{{organizationName}} {{productName}}". While the variables are correct, consider if repeating them is the best approach from a readability perspective. Can they be simplified or referenced differently?
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review for readability and consider alternative phrasing to avoid repetition of variables if possible.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'revoke the consent' is not perfectly translated. While 'ຍົກເລີກການຕົກລົງ' is understandable, a more natural translation might be 'ຖອນການຕົກລົງ' or 'ຍຸຕິການຕົກລົງ'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເມື່ອທ່ານຖອນການຕົກລົງໃຫ້ໃຊ້ຂໍ້ມູນການຮັບຮອງຕົວ...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrasing 'ບໍລິການ {{name}}' sounds slightly unnatural in Lao. It's better to rephrase to describe the context more clearly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເມື່ອທ່ານຍົກເລີກການຕົກລົງໃຫ້ໃຊ້ຂໍ້ມູນການຮັບຮອງຕົວ {{organizationName}} {{productName}} ຂອງແອັບຯ ຫຼື ບໍລິການ {{name}}...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'automatically stop logging into' is translated as 'automātiski pārtrauksiet pieteikšanos šeit:'. While technically correct, it sounds awkward and less natural in Latvian. A more accurate and fluent translation would be something like 'automātiski vairs nevarēsiet pieteikties'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: automātiski vairs nevarēsiet pieteikties

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of 'šeit:' before each instance of {{name}} feels redundant and breaks the flow of the sentence. It's unnecessary in Latvian.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove 'šeit:' before each {{name}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'in de diensten' is grammatically awkward. It should be rephrased for better flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Zodra u de toestemming voor het gebruik van de {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth gegevens in {{name}} intrekt, stoppen {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch met inloggen op {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure is a bit clunky. It can be simplified for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Zodra u de toestemming intrekt voor het gebruik van de {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth gegevens in {{name}}, stopt {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch met inloggen op {{name}}. Uw account op {{name}} wordt niet verwijderd.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'intrekt' (to revoke) is more appropriate in this context than 'gebruik' (use).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Zodra u de toestemming intrekt voor het gebruik van de {{organizationName}} {{productName}} auth gegevens in {{name}}, stopt {{organizationName}} {{productName}} automatisch met inloggen op {{name}}. Uw account op {{name}} wordt niet verwijderd.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation contains a repetition of '{{productName}} {{organizationName}}'. The English only mentions the organization and product once in this context. The repeated phrase makes the sentence awkward and unclear.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po wycofaniu zgody na użycie danych autoryzacji {{organizationName}} dla {{productName}} w usłudze {{name}}, {{organizationName}} przestanie automatycznie logować się w {{name}}. Twoje konto w {{name}} nie zostanie usunięte.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure is slightly awkward. While grammatically correct, it could be improved for better flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po wycofaniu zgody na użycie danych autoryzacji {{organizationName}} dla {{productName}} w usłudze {{name}}, {{organizationName}} przestanie automatycznie logować się do {{name}}. Twoje konto w {{name}} nie zostanie usunięte.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'eliminada' (eliminated) is used for 'deleted'. While technically correct, 'apagada' or 'desativada' might be more natural and commonly used in Portuguese when referring to an account in a service.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Depois de revogar o consentimento para usar os dados de autenticação {{organizationName}} {{productName}} no serviço {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} interromperá automaticamente o login em {{name}}. A sua conta em {{name}} não será apagada/desativada.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation uses 'de serviciul {{name}}'. A more natural phrasing would be 'pentru serviciul {{name}}' or 'în cadrul serviciului {{name}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Odată ce ați revocat consimțământul pentru utilizarea datelor de autentificare {{organizationName}} {{productName}} pentru serviciul {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} va opri automat autentificarea pentru {{name}}. Contul dvs {{name}} nu va fi șters.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Contul dvs {{name}}' is slightly awkward. It's better to use 'contul dumneavoastră în {{name}}' or 'contul tău din {{name}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Odată ce ați revocat consimțământul pentru utilizarea datelor de autentificare {{organizationName}} {{productName}} pentru serviciul {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} va opri automat autentificarea pentru {{name}}. Contul dumneavoastră în {{name}} nu va fi șters.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'revoke' is awkwardly translated as ' අව revoke'. It's a direct transliteration and doesn't flow naturally in Sinhala. A more appropriate translation would depend on the intended nuance, but 'ඉවත් කිරීම' (ivata kirima - removal) or 'අහෝසි කිරීම' (ahosi kirima - abolishment) would be better alternatives.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ {{organizationName}} {{productName}} හි බලපත්‍රය {{name}} සේවාවේ භාවිතය සඳහා ඉවත් කිරීම කළ පසු

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ඇතුළු වීම' (athuluvima - entering) is not the best way to describe logging in. 'පිවිහ යැම' (piviha yama) or 'පිවිසීම' (pivisima) would be more accurate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබ {{organizationName}} {{productName}} හි බලපත්‍රය {{name}} සේවාවේ භාවිතය සඳහා ඉවත් කිරීම කළ පසු, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} විසින් {{name}} වෙත පිවිසීම ස්වයංක්‍රීයව නවත්වනු ලැබේ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'auth data' is translated as 'autorizačných údajov'. While technically correct, 'prístupových údajov' might be a more natural and common translation in this context, especially when referring to authentication data.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Po odvolaní súhlasu na používanie {{organizationName}} {{productName}} prístupových údajov v službe {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} sa automaticky prestane prihlasovať do služby {{name}}. Váš účet v {{name}} nebude vymazaný.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "automatically stop logging into" is translated as "samodejno prenehal prijavljati v". While understandable, a more natural and accurate translation would be "samodejno nehalo prijavljati v" or "samodejno ne bo več prijavo v".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ko prekličete soglasje za uporabo podatkov o avtorizaciji {{organizationName}} {{productName}} v storitvi {{name}}, se bo {{organizationName}} {{productName}} samodejno nehalo prijavljati v {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word "пристанак" (pristanak) translates more closely to 'agreement' or 'acceptance' rather than 'consent'.  While understandable, it'd be more accurate to use a more direct translation of consent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Када опозовете сагласност за коришћење {{organizationName}} {{productName}} података за ауторизацију у сервису {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} ће аутоматски престати да се пријављује на {{name}}. Ваш налог на {{name}} неће бити обрисан.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'prijavljuje' is more accurately translated as 'ulazi' or 'povezuje' in this context. 'Prijavljuje' implies a user action, whereas the system automatically stops logging in.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kada opozovete pristanak za korišćenje {{organizationName}} {{productName}} podataka za autorizaciju u servisu {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} će automatski prestati da se povezuje na {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While not strictly incorrect, the repetitive use of '{{organizationName}} {{productName}}' can be slightly clunky. Consider if the sentence can be restructured to avoid this repetition.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Kada opozovete pristanak za korišćenje podataka za autorizaciju {{organizationName}} {{productName}} u servisu {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} će automatski prestati da se povezuje na {{name}}. Vaš nalog na {{name}} neće biti obrisan.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Turkish translation consistently uses '{{name}}' which is a placeholder and not naturally occurring in Turkish. It should be replaced with the actual service name.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace all instances of '{{name}}' with the actual service name in Turkish, e.g., 'bu hizmette' or the specific Turkish name of the service.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'otomatik olarak {{name}} üzerinde oturum açmayı durduracaktır' is awkward. A more natural phrasing would indicate that the user will stop logging in to the service.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider revising to something like '{{organizationName}} {{productName}} otomatik olarak {{name}} hizmetinde oturumunuzu kapatacaktır' or '{{organizationName}} {{productName}} otomatik olarak {{name}} hizmetinden çıkış yapmanızı sağlayacaktır'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "входити до" is awkward and not the best translation for "logging into." A more natural phrasing would be "автоматично не зможе входити" or "перестане автоматично авторизуватися".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Після того як ви відкликаєте згоду на використання даних аутентифікації {{productName}} {{organizationName}} в службі {{name}}, {{productName}} {{organizationName}} перестане автоматично авторизуватися в {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, "авторизуватися" is more formal than "logging into" implies. A simpler phrasing could also work.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Після того як ви відкликаєте згоду на використання даних аутентифікації {{productName}} {{organizationName}} в службі {{name}}, {{productName}} {{organizationName}} припинить автоматично входити до {{name}}.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses "{{productName}}{{organizationName}" which creates a concatenated name. It should likely be separated by a space or other appropriate connector based on the desired style.  It might be more natural to say '{{productName}} {{organizationName}}' or '{{productName}} của {{organizationName}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using '{{productName}} {{organizationName}}' or '{{productName}} của {{organizationName}}' depending on the desired style.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation maintains the template variables {{organizationName}}, {{productName}}, and {{name}} exactly as in the English version. While technically correct, it might benefit from a more natural phrasing in Chinese to avoid jarring repetition and make it more user-friendly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing the sentence to naturally integrate the organization and product names without explicitly repeating the template variables. For example, '在您撤销在服务{{name}}中使用{{organizationName}} {{productName}}身份验证数据的同意后，{{organizationName}} {{productName}}的登录将自动停止...' (After you revoke consent for {{organizationName}} {{productName}} authentication data to be used in service {{name}}, {{organizationName}} {{productName}} login will automatically stop...)
